utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Stop it! What are you talking about? Oh, a fountain! I love fountains! Let's skinny dip!

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Go on, baby.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Come on. It'll be fun.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Now? Are you kidding?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: If you catch me, you can have me.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Okay! I'm coming! You got it. I'm coming! They're coming off right now.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Take your pants off! Get over here!

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: I've got you! I'm coming!

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: "I swear, Jasmine, this has always been the way with you. You can't just go through life asking for an egg in your beer and your money back twice."

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: "Your money back twice!"

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry. "Mama, if I'm such a disappointment to you, I don't know why you even bother coming home. Isn't that right, Granny?"

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: "Shut up, both of you. I'm trying to watch my stories."

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: "Oh, I wish I'd never left Paris." And, scene. Good. Good, all right. Let's take it from the top.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, guys. Come on. Don't you want me to land this role?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course we do. It's just...

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Look, we are talking about the lead in a Broadway play. This is a potential gold mine. If it's a hit, who knows how long it could run? Then I could take it on the road.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You mean you'd leave us?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, only for nine months of the year. Oh, don't look so sad. And, you, don't look so happy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Castle. I'll be right there. All right. Death. Murder. Mayhem. Whole enchilada. Sorry to bail on rehearsal.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, don't worry. Alexis can read both parts. It's all right if she misses a morning of school, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Take me with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To a crime scene?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It'd be educational. Please?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Find your own hiding place.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Caucasian female. A couple of skinny dippers found her this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bet that killed the mood.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Purse is missing. No ID. And get this, we couldn't find her shoes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm gonna go with... still with Prince Charming at the ball. Should we look for a pumpkin and some mice? I guess not.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Canvass the buildings surrounding the plaza and get uniforms to check trash cans and dumpsters for her purse.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Aye, aye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cause of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Stabbing. There's a fatal wound in her back. Maybe a robbery gone wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe. We gotta find out who she is and what she was doing here so late, though.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, she's tall, she's gorgeous, ten pounds underweight. Her hair is fried, she's wearing too much eye makeup. She's a model. Which means she was probably at a club last night. It is, after all, Fashion Week, when all the hottest women in the world descend upon the hippest nightspots like locusts. Only, locusts eat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you tell me who killed her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then pipe down.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: This was on her wrist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was at a club. That's Teddy Farrow's logo. He designs clothes for women. Upscale, expensive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, my credit card and I are painfully aware of Teddy's designs. I almost asked for custody of them after my last divorce.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there a label in her dress?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Teddy Farrow Collection.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, if she is one of his models, maybe he can identify her for us. Thank you, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You're welcome.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can already see the blurb on my next book jacket. "It's Fashion Week in New York City, and the clothes are to die for."

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Five minutes, people!

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: That's Jenna. Jenna McBoyd. She was supposed to walk for me today. My God, what happened?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was stabbed sometime this morning.

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: I can't believe it. I mean, I saw her last night at my party.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you notice anything unusual at the party?

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: She was agitated. But that wasn't so unusual for her these days.

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: That one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea what was wrong?

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: Yeah. She was stressed out. Hey! Not the pink sash, the blue one.

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: Look, Jenna was a small-town girl. I mean, straight off the bus from Ohio.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You're saying she was an innocent?

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: She was a rising star, but she wasn't ready for what was coming her way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Four minutes, people! Four minutes.

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: I mean I was thinking of making her the face of my campaign. That would have meant photo shoots, magazines, billboards in Times Square, travel, not to mention a very generous paycheck.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That seems to be all pretty heady stuff for a naive young girl.

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: In recent weeks, she'd become so bad-tempered, paranoid. I'd started to wonder if she wasn't too inexperienced for a major campaign.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You said that she was paranoid. Any chance she was doing drugs?

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: Not her style.

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: Teddy, if you want me to shoot the girls, you need to get that boy-band poser out of my seat.

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: Wyatt, I'll take care of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Farrow, just a couple more questions.

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: Yes, but quickly, please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who was Jenna with last night at your party? Castle, focus.

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: I only saw her briefly. She spent most of her time with Sierra, her best friend. That's Sierra there, with the wedding gown. So, if that's all, now I really must take care of last-minute details.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh. Uh, one last thing. When Jenna left your party, was she wearing shoes?

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: Yes, Christian Louboutin pink satin pumps I'd lent her for the evening. The dress she was wearing was a one-of-a-kind. I don't suppose we can have it returned?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's in evidence now. And it has a hole in the back of it, where she was stabbed.

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: Rick Castle! It's so funny I ran into you today. I just bought this on my way in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, look at that. It's my cover.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And it's on stands already.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "Richard Castle gets the inspiration for his latest novel, Heat Wave, and his new character, Nikki Heat, from New York's finest." That's nice, right?

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: Could you...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, absolutely. Who should I make it out to?

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: Oh, you don't remember me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, of course I do. Yeah, you're...

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: Rina.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rina. Yes. We met at that party. With that, that thing. That was late, it was crazy, that... Wow, what a night.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Let's go, models, take your places. I need you up here and in line.

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: Here.

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: Call me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You're in here, too, you know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: SIERRA
utterance.content: Oh, God, I feel sick. And I'm wearing her gown. She was supposed to close the show today, not me. I-- I called her this morning like a million times, but it just kept going to voicemail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When did Jenna leave the party?

utterance.speaker: SIERRA
utterance.content: A-- around midnight. I assumed she was going home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Farrow mentioned that she seemed agitated lately.

utterance.speaker: SIERRA
utterance.content: Tomorrow, Teddy's announcing the new face of his collection. Jenna was up for the job and she was a little tense, but she didn't have any reason to be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: SIERRA
utterance.content: She was a lock. Jenna was Teddy's favorite. Oh, God. Does Travis know? Her husband? He's gonna be devastated. They were so in love.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: I went to bed around eleven, I figured she'd wake me when she got in. But at 3 a.m. she wasn't home, so I called her cell phone. She wasn't there. I called the cops. They said I had to wait 48 hours till I could report her missing. I told them, "Y-- you don't know my wife. If she's not home by now, something happened to her." God, I should have been there. These parties, you know, they're just... Everyone is so phony.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Travis, I know this is difficult, but I have to ask you this question. Was there anyone that you can think of that would want to do harm to Jenna?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: You're kidding, right? W-- we filed the reports. D-- didn't the other cops send them to you guys?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Reports?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: For harassment. Some guy was sending Jenna letters, like, writing all sorts of sick things. He was taking pictures of her, too. It's like he was watching us all the time. She was falling apart. I mean, we both were. Hell, we almost moved back home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you filed a report?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: Yeah. A dozen of them, and every time you people said the same damn thing. That this is New York and you got more important things to do than to track down some annoying fan. And now she's dead. My wife is dead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The letters were mailed from the Soho post office. No return address. No signature.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, the anonymous stalker didn't write down his name and number.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm just saying.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "I saw you today in the subway. Did you see me? I wanted to taste you."

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That's pretty sick stuff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But he doesn't make any direct threats. That's why Jenna and Travis couldn't get the beat cops to take them seriously.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Boy, two small-town kids go to the big city to follow their dreams and then this. Not the fairy-tale ending they were looking for, I'm sure.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know, to take these shots, he would have had to have been on a rooftop pretty close to the apartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No wonder she was freaked out. Find the roof, see if there's anything up there that we can use to identify him. Those cops let Jenna down once. We're not gonna do it again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello! I'm home, and I brought Chow Fun.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, nice. But I already picked up a copy on my way home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, did you read it? Was she kind?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The writer loved you. She loved Detective Beckett. She even loved the book. It was your basic puff piece.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I'm sure my mother will find something to say that will keep me from getting too puffed.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Not tonight, she won't. She's in her room, mourning the death of her career.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, she didn't get that play?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: She did. Just not the part she wanted. The producers said she's not right to play the lead. They want her to play the crazy granny.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, the crazy granny.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Who dies in act one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Offstage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You expecting a call?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A call back, actually. I met a nice young woman at Fashion Week. I left her a message about an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: A model?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gee, Dad. Picking up hotties while you're working a case?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She picked me up, as a matter of fact. She said we knew each other from... somewhere.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It's a curse, being so irresistible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What's this one's name? Lola? Bree? Tatiana?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rina.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Did you say "Rina"?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Blonde hair?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Bambi eyes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Cute little overbite?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, you know Rina. She used to baby-sit me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She used to what you?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Baby-sit. Remember? We watched High School Musical together. Like, a million times.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I-- I vaguely remember a-- a... Like, a gangly girl with stringy hair and braces named Katrina.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That's the one. She did the whole ugly-duckling-to-swan thing, shortened her name and became a model. That's so funny that you ran into her. The world is really small.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Small and cruel.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I'm putting the time of death between 2:00 and 5:00 a.m.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She left the party at midnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, where was she for two hours?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any signs of sexual assault?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, but she put up a fight. There's some bruising on her arms and hands, her dress was torn, there's a cut inside of her cheek, indicating that she was slapped hard. But here's the weird part. She was stabbed with something long and sharp. It wasn't your typical blade.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, based on the wound, I made a reconstruction.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It's four-sided. It's slimmer at the tip and gets progressively wider at the base. Also, I found traces of glass in the wound.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was stabbed with the Washington Monument?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Esposito, any luck?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Rooftop is right across the street from the vic's apartment. East access.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You find anything?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Lots of cigarette butts, soda cans. And an empty package for a digital camera memory card.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get it to CSU, see if you can pull any prints.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: On our way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything else?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah. Preliminary tox screen indicated her blood alcohol was 0.02, and there were traces of Addmair in her system.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's that?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It's a form of speed, usually prescribed to people with ADD. But models have been known to buy it off the street and use it for weight loss.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So much for her being anti-drug.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I guess the job and the stalker weren't the only things making her tense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you find it odd Jenna had a stalker?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, not really. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, she wasn't Heidi Klum. She hadn't even had a national campaign.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe the guy figured he was getting in on the ground floor, stalker-wise, you know. Beat the rush.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh! You couldn't resist, could you? Pretty nice write-up, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. If you like those sorts of fluff pieces.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fluff? The reporter made you sound like you're a cross between Sherlock Holmes and Angelina Jolie. And the picture isn't half-bad, either. Although, you don't always need to cross your arms.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why are you upset?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm not upset.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You look upset.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I'm not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But if you were upset, you would tell me, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But if you were.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It doesn't matter because I'm not upset.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, well, well. Richard Castle. The man of the hour.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, do you mean this? Pretty flattering, right? At least, I thought so.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Old news, my friend. We're talking about yesterday, Fashion Week.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Word on the street is you brought back a little souvenir.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The digits of a particularly young honey named Reno?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Rina.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I might have mentioned it to them in passing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come on, Castle. Take pity on your model-deprived brothers. Give us the stats. Was she the sexy, curvy, lingerie type that you could just...

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or th-- the toned and tanned, bikini-wearing type?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She's more like the "I'm totally psyched I just got my driver's license" type.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, you know what? You two so need to evolve, because that little girl you're talking about like a piece of meat, that's somebody's daughter, all right? She's somebody's baby-sitter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, CSU matched a print off the memory card packaging.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Will James.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh-huh. Real charm-boy. On probation for domestic assault. A couple of restraining orders.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sounds like our guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Will James, NYPD.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We're all clear.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, clear in here, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys. Look what I found.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jenna's comp card.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Comp card?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, agencies use it to get models work.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A single comp card? That's not very stalker-y. Where's the big, creepy wall of Jenna?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think I got something. A camera with a telephoto lens.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What has it got on it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nothing. Maybe it's been erased.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah. Q-Tech, four gigs. Same as the empty package on the roof.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get it to CSU. See if they can recover the photos.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If this guy had a thing for Jenna, he sure was subtle about it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you know what a comp card is?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Me, neither.

utterance.speaker: WILL JAMES
utterance.content: Can I help you, officers?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Will James? Get your hands up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We can place you on the rooftop of the building across from her. So, if you weren't taking photos, what were you doing there?

utterance.speaker: WILL JAMES
utterance.content: I didn't kill her, all right? I wasn't even here Sunday, I was working.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right, at the casino over in Atlantic City. Don't worry, we're running it down now. In the meantime, maybe you can explain how this got in your apartment.

utterance.speaker: WILL JAMES
utterance.content: Having pictures of hot chicks is not a crime.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, but sending them threatening letters is. If I may.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "You were wearing a lot of makeup today. It made you look like a slut."

utterance.speaker: WILL JAMES
utterance.content: You guys think I wrote that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That guy is aptly named. He gives me the willies.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We have a problem. His alibi checks out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You got to be kidding me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mm-mmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I talked to the manager of the casino where he works. He says that Will James was there the night the girl was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There's got to be some kind of mistake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe his boss is in on it. Covering for his friend.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I thought so, so they sent over the security footage. James was parking cars all night. He's not our guy.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: Okay, I don't... I don't understand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We're holding him on stalking charges. But he didn't kill her.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: He sent those letters, right? He took the pictures.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We won't know for sure unless CSU is able to recover files from the camera card. Whoever killed Jenna, we will find them. I promise.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: Okay, just whatever I can do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, there is something that we're trying to figure out. The medical examiner said that she found Addmair in Jenna's bloodstream. It's a type of amphetamine.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: No. No, Jenna didn't use drugs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Some people say that she'd been acting nervous lately. Edgy.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: Sure, that was the stress. Look, these letters, they really scared her, she didn't want to tell people at work about them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How were things going for her at work? Was there anyone she didn't get along with? Mr. Farrow, perhaps?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: No, look. She loved Teddy. She got along good with everyone. I don't know, maybe this one guy. A photographer. They had a fight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: I guess he was the guy that was gonna shoot the Farrow campaign, so last week he and Jenna, they did this test shoot. She came home crying. Said that her pictures were awful. She was worried she wouldn't get the job now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did Jenna say what went wrong?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: She said that he just didn't like her. He was trying to ruin it for her by making her look bad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This photographer. Do you know his name?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Monroe, what happened between you and Jenna?

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: Look, Jenna was a great model and a great girl, but that day she was unfocused, awkward. We had words, but we resolved our issues.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: I agreed to do another test, on my time and my dime. We were supposed to meet yesterday after the runway show, but...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you confirm where you were at between 1:00 and 5:00 a.m. the night she died?

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: I was at the Zac Posen party until three and then home, asleep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Mr. Monroe.

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: Mmm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: MALE ANNOUNCER
utterance.content: Ladies and gentlemen, Teddy Farrow.

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: Good afternoon. It's been a hard week for us here at Teddy Farrow. As I'm sure you've heard, we lost one of our own on Sunday night. Jenna McBoyd was taken from this world too soon. But even as we honor her memory, she would have wanted us to carry on. And that's why I've invited you here to introduce the new face of my collection. She's an exciting talent, and together we shall achieve great things. I give you Miss Sierra Goodwin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There's Sierra, stepping in for her good friend Jenna, again. Is it just me, or does she look really happy? What was it that Teddy was saying about his new face? Her picture in every magazine, a billboard in Times Square, a huge paycheck. Definitely worth killing for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you're talking about one girl murdering another for a job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's not a job, it's a campaign, a career maker. Jealousy is a classic motive. You've seen the films. The Talented Mr. Ripley, Dead Ringers, and of course, the underrated classic, Showgirls.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nobody murdered anyone in Showgirls. I hear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sierra wants to be Teddy's favorite, but she's always second choice. Sierra thinks, "What if Jenna was gone? Then I'd be number one. Then I would finally get everything that I deserve." And then one night, she sees her chance. She lures Jenna somewhere quiet, deserted. And when Jenna turns her back, Sierra stabs her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With the statue of the Washington Monument that she carries in her purse?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then steals her shoes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not a perfect theory, but we're here anyway, so no harm in learning a little bit more about what makes Sierra Goodwin tick.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I see just the girl to clue us in.

utterance.speaker: MALE PHOTOGRAPHER
utterance.content: Perfect! Move! There you go, that's it!

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: Rick!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, that's "Mr. Castle" to you, missy. Rina, this is Detective Beckett. Detective Beckett, Rina. She used to baby-sit for me. Or, I mean, Alexis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don't say.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, we're here about Jenna.

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: Oh, that was so terrible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Was it true that she and Sierra Goodwin were kind of BFFs?

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: I wouldn't say BFFs. Sierra's more of a frenemy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: She doesn't play well with others.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She ever push anybody down the stairs?

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: No. Stupid stuff, really. Lying about when a call time is. Itching powder in your underwear. Wait, and this one time, she crushed up a diet pill and dropped it into another model's champagne.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You're saying she dosed someone?

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: The girl got all wired and called Calvin Klein a boring old fart, to his face.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Rina. You've been very helpful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You got something you want to share with the class?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was just thinking, maybe Jenna didn't use drugs. Maybe Sierra was slipping them into her drinks when Teddy Farrow was around, to make her seem crazy or paranoid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now that is an evil deed worthy of the Showgirls special edition.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are those two doing here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, guys, what's going on?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tech managed to recover the deleted photos from Will James' memory card. He might not have been Jenna's killer, but he was definitely her stalker.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you drove all the way down here just to show me this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We thought you'd want them right away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is so thoughtful of you guys.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What do you think, Beckett? You missing the glamorous life?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The what life?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle, hey, is your, uh, your girl here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Rina.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Rina used to baby-sit Alexis, fellas. So, as far as Big Rick here is concerned, she might as well be wearing a chastity belt.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you for that visual image. That's... and also, thank you for calling me "Big Rick."

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, by the way, our buddy Will has a girlfriend we might want to talk to. There's, uh, some photos of her right here in the back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmm. Naked photos.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, check this out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at naked pictures? If you insist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She's Will James' girlfriend? Looks like Teddy Farrow isn't the only guy that Sierra was modeling for.

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: Have you any idea of the spectacle you just caused? I mean, why the hell would you drag the face of my campaign out of my launch party and bring her down here as if she was some sort of criminal?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because she is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Will James' confession. He admits Sierra hired him to take the stalker photos of Jenna. He even helped her write the letters. And he claims he was supplying Sierra with Addmair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was dosing Jenna. She was trying to make her seem paranoid around you.

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: Why would she do that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To prey on the fears of a naive couple, pressure them into moving back to Ohio so Sierra could take her place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Farrow, have you ever heard of the expression, "I would kill for that job"?

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: But she was my face. My face! I mean, have you any idea what this will do to me, that scandal? It will taint the entire spring line!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A girl is dead, Mr. Farrow. Does that mean anything to you?

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: It doesn't mean my business should suffer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They're just clothes.

utterance.speaker: TEDDY FARROW
utterance.content: Just clothes, Detective? Clothes are civilization. Clothes are what separate us from animals.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not always.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was your only competition. You needed her out of the way, and you were running out of time.

utterance.speaker: SIERRA
utterance.content: No. No. I didn't kill her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right, you just drugged her and sent her threatening letters.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you at 2 a.m. on Sunday night? Sierra, you are facing a murder charge. If you have something to say, now would be the time.

utterance.speaker: SIERRA
utterance.content: She went to Wyatt's place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The photographer?

utterance.speaker: SIERRA
utterance.content: Jenna wasn't just being paranoid when she said Wyatt sabotaged her photo shoot. He did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: SIERRA
utterance.content: Because Jenna wouldn't sleep with him. It's like an open secret with the girls. You give Wyatt what he wants, he gives you great shots. If you don't, he can ruin you. And he wanted Jenna.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, he was making her choose between her career and her marriage vows? Nice guy.

utterance.speaker: SIERRA
utterance.content: She knew the photos from the second test had to be great or she really would lose the job. She needed him to do it right this time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what happened on Sunday?

utterance.speaker: SIERRA
utterance.content: She told me she had a plan. I figured she was gonna give Wyatt what he wanted. I just told her, "It's not the worst thing in the world, you know. You might even like it." I did. That was the last time I saw her alive.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We just got the rundown on Wyatt Monroe. No priors. But turns out his apartment is right next door to the arts center, and his living room overlooks the fountain where Jenna was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He lives next to the crime scene?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We ran that alibi that he gave you. Witnesses at the Zac Posen party said he left around 11:30.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He told us he left at 3 a.m.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, there's more. We checked with the Teddy Farrow people. They said he got to their party just before midnight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He lied to us.

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: I can't tell you how shocked I was when Sierra was arrested.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you two close?

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: I wouldn't say close, but I did a number of sessions with her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we've heard. That's a really nice view.

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: Thanks. So, how can I help?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You can tell me why you didn't mention going to the Farrow party on Sunday night.

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: Must have slipped my mind. It's Fashion Week. I go to a lot of parties.

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: Hey, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, don't mind me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you talk to Jenna at the party?

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: I think I did. But just to say hello.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You didn't plan on a rendezvous later on at your place?

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, really? Then whose are these?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Christian Louboutin pink satin pumps, on loan from Teddy Farrow.

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: I don't know who those belong to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is this award, Mr. Monroe?

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: It's the Hilo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: "For excellence in editorial photography." Looks like one of these is missing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Monroe, where is it?

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: The cleaning woman, uh, dropped it last week. It broke.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, it looks just like the Washington Monument.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It does, doesn't it?

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: Okay, look, Jenna was at my place on Sunday night, but she was alive when she left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why was she there?

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: She found me at Teddy's party. Said she had a change of heart. Wanted us to work together from now on as a team.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you assumed that was code for "do me."

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: We agreed to meet back at my place. She came in, we had a drink, got comfortable on the couch. I was ready to get down to business, but she kept wanting to talk about our deal. That's what she called it. Said she wanted me to tell her exactly what she had to do to get good shots. Exactly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was trying to get you to incriminate yourself.

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: A master spy this girl was not. I grabbed her purse, pulled out her phone. The damn thing had an app on it that turned it into a recorder. She taped our whole conversation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She wanted to record him demanding sex for good shots so she could play it for Teddy Farrow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: She grabbed the phone back. We struggled. She picked up my award off the shelf, started waving it around and acting crazy. She smacked the Hilo into a bookshelf, the tip broke off. I tried to grab it,

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: she cut me with the edge, so I backed off and she left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, that's a great story, but I don't believe you.

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: Just listen to the recording on her phone. I'm telling you the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Her purse was never found. So it looks like the evidence that'll clear you is lying in a landfill somewhere, along with your Hilo. Tough break.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here I thought modeling was glamorous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not everybody in that business is predatory.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It sure seems that way. Jenna's best friend was drugging her, and her photographer killed her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Even her clothing designer seemed more interested in his show than in her murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But at least we got the bad guy. That's something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Wyatt killed her, why didn't he do a better job of cleaning up his place? And why would he leave her body right outside of his apartment?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe he's not that bright.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe he was telling the truth. Maybe he didn't do it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's up with the stroll down memory lane?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I called my agent and told him to pass on the play. I said, "Martha Rodgers does not die in the first act, and she never dies offstage."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Feel better?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No. I feel rotten and old. I feel like I'm dying offstage. I was always the ingénue. The lead. The star. I liked it that way. It's a powerful thing, kiddo. To be young, beautiful, talented. No woman wants to give it up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are still beautiful, and you are still talented. And you didn't give up your youth. You traded it for wisdom.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Wisdom. Wisdom.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Give me that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rina? Hey, are we still on for that date tonight? All right. You remember where I live? I'll see you then.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Alexis told me all about it. That girl is too young for you. Or I should say, you are too old for her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It is not what you think.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And unemployed divas who live in glass houses, rent-free, should not throw stones.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Point taken.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's the good word?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sunshine Electronics.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's two words.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nope, that 's where Jenna McBoyd bought her new cell phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, I was talking to her husband last night, and on a hunch I asked him about her cell phone. He said it wouldn't accommodate a recording app. So, I checked into her credit card receipts. She bought a new cell phone the day she died. And it had GPS in it, which she had the foresight to switch on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You found it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In a dumpster on West 81st. Uniforms are bringing it in now.

utterance.speaker: JENNA
utterance.content: Stop it, Wyatt!

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: Give me that phone!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So far, it's happening just like he said it did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is when he said she grabbed the weapon.

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: Give that to me!

utterance.speaker: JENNA
utterance.content: You stay away from me!

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: Be careful with that thing.

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: Damn it! I'm bleeding, you crazy *****.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sounds like she left the place alive.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Doesn't mean he didn't go after her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, if he was gonna kill her, he wouldn't let her leave the apartment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shh. It's still going.

utterance.speaker: JENNA
utterance.content: I need a cab. I've gotta get out of here. Oh, my God. Did you follow me? Wait, let go of me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, what's our plan?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Make him confess.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don't think he's gonna crack that easy. I mean, what if he figures out we only have a partial recording? That the memory on the phone ran out before the actual murder took place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He won't.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We, uh... We don't have any proof that he did it. I mean, what if he shuts down and doesn't talk?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He won't.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He's not a stupid man. He might ask for a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He won't. Look, let me handle this. You can go in if you want, but don't speak.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don't speak.

utterance.speaker: JENNA
utterance.content: Why did you follow me?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: Well, it seems like I had a good reason.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: Okay, wait. She was recording me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You followed her to Farrow's party Sunday night, and then to Monroe's apartment.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: You don't understand! She just... She'd been acting so strange lately. And then Sierra tells me about this photographer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You talked with Sierra about Wyatt Monroe?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: She was worried about me and Jenna. That it wa-- was more than just business between them. Something was going on. Look, once this was in my head, I-- I couldn't stop thinking about it. Yeah, I followed her to the party. They were together. When she didn't go home and she went to his place instead, I knew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so then you waited.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: She came out, her clothes were all messed up. Her lipstick was rubbed off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You called her a *****.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: I told her that she was my wife. My wife. And she... She just started crying. She... She said I didn't understand, that I was just like everybody else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Travis, I can't help you unless you tell me the truth.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: Look, I didn't mean... Look, I just... I couldn't... I couldn't see straight. It's like I wasn't even myself anymore. I was so mad. I just... I didn't even know what I was doing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And so you killed her.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: No! No. I didn't kill her. Teddy did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Teddy Farrow?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: Oh, man, it was always Teddy. It was Teddy this, Teddy that. Just like, whispering in her ear, you know. Telling her how to walk, how to talk, who to be. Just feeding her mind with lies. I'll tell you what, if anyone did it, it was him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was you, Travis, in the plaza, not Teddy. Standing by the fountain, thinking about all the things you'd done for her. About how you moved to this city that you hated, only to be treated like this. Now, she had something in her hands, something sharp. What was it? Travis, do you really want me to turn that tape on? Do you really want to listen to what you said and what you did?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: She was holding this broken glass. Told me to stay away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And so you took it from her.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: It just happened.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS
utterance.content: I... I stabbed her. I stabbed her in the back. She was... She was trying to leave me. I loved her so much. I just... I couldn't let her leave me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She wasn't gonna leave you, Travis.

utterance.speaker: WYATT
utterance.content: What the hell! You're recording me?

utterance.speaker: JENNA
utterance.content: Give it back, Wyatt. I-- I didn't know what else to do! I-- I want the job, Wyatt, but I love my husband. I can't do this to him. I won't! You're hurting me. I just want to go home! I want to go home!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Home. She was trying to go home to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was a risky bluff, threatening to play a recording we didn't even have.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It didn't seem like a risk to me. He loved his wife very much. He wouldn't want to relive her death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, what about Sierra? What about Wyatt Monroe? They just go free? That doesn't sound like justice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I spoke with Teddy Farrow this morning. Now that he understands what those two did to Jenna, he's gonna launch a very different kind of campaign. He's gonna get them blackballed in the industry. No one will hire them again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, you mean poetic justice. Well, as a writer, I guess I can live with that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wish I could feel that way. I wish I could feel a sense of victory. So, what would Nikki Heat do after a bad day?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She'd go home, pour a stiff drink, run a hot bath, read a good book.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Too bad I don't have a good book to read.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm. I'd let you have Heat Wave, but my publisher doesn't want any copies leaking out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why'd you let that Cosmo reporter read it, then?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that's for publicity purposes. You know, you want the press to have a little taste of... Wait, whoa. Is... is that why you've been so upset? Because I let her read it before you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I am the inspiration. I should be reading it before a reporter does.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why didn't you just say so?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why didn't you just give it to me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why didn't you ask?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why didn't it occur to you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You'll have it by tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looking good, Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you guys...?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We're detectives.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Called your dad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Okay. You guys have had your fun. I was 17 and I thought that modeling would be an easier way to make money than waitressing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was one summer, no big deal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if you guys tell Castle about this, I will kill you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Good evening, my dears.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You look in brighter spirits. What's changed since this morning?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: The play that I passed on, the producers came back with a better offer. I was just at the Dorchester signing my contracts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, you got the lead?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, no, I still play the crazy granny.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But you... You don't die?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, still die.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: More money?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Peanuts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, so what's the better offer?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: They have rewritten the script so that I die onstage. My death closes act one. It's better than the lead, really. Granny's the bravura role.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In art, as in life.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I'm so proud of you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Aw. Thank you. Thank you, my baby.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Are we expecting company?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, that's Rina.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, of course. Your date.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not my date.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: Hey! Ready for a High School Musical marathon?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I'm so ready.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Rina.

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: Hi, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: RINA
utterance.content: Oh, my gosh. That shirt is so cute on you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Color me shocked, but apparently the modeling world isn't all sexy clothes and fun parties. It occurred to me that if Jenna McBoyd had someone looking out for her a little bit, she might still be alive today. So, if Rina needs a friend, she knows she's got one.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, my son, the big softy. And don't worry, I know you have an image to protect. Your secret's safe with me.
